title: Personalized Science E-Learning Environment Design: Experimentation and Inquiry Strategies Based on Implicit Memory

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science knowledge (experimental design, data analysis) and experience using digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment for science education targeting teenage university students. Combines digital tool-supported implicit memory reinforcement activities (repetitive experiment simulations) with offline discussions (experiment result analysis, evidence-based conclusions)

learning_goals: Learners reconstruct scientific hypotheses and variable controls based on implicit memory to perform experimental designs with over 80% accuracy

Using static images (experiment graphs, data charts) and dynamic animations (chemical reaction simulations) provided at 10–30 second intervals, learners select and apply ≥3 personalized visual cue strategies (highlighting observation points, evidence marking) to maintain attention spans during scientific inquiry processes for over 70% of class time
Utilizing contextual cues (experimental conditions, measurement data patterns) provided in e-learning environments demonstrates over 30% improvement in efficiency when solving scientific problems
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
